page.title: 06THE PROPOSED HARWICH MARINA
page.content: IN 1965 MR LLOYD HARE OFFERED Â£100 FOR THE LAND TO BUILD THE MARINA. IT WAS GRANTED BUT HIS PLAN WENT NO FURTHER. THEN IN 1975 A COLCHESTER MAN APPLIED FOR PLANNING PERMISSION, BUT HE DID NOT SUPPLY DETAILS FOR SEWAGE DISPOSAL. MR HAMMERTON'S PROPOSAL WAS FOR A Â£25,000 MARINA ON THE WEST BAY. A PRESTON FIRM IS BEHIND THE NEWLY PROPOSED MARINA, AND THE ARCHITECT IS MR. PETER BROOK FROM IPSWICH. THE WORK ON THE MARINA IS DUE TO START IN 1986 AND WILL BE FINISHED BY 1989. THERE WILL BE 1,000 BERTHS FOR BOATS AND 150 JOBS CREATED,WITH BETWEEN 250_300 JOBS AVAILABLE WHEN ITS FINISHED. IT IS HOPED THAT IT WILL CONTAIN A HOTEL,SUPERMARKET,SHOPS,A CHANDLERY,BOAT BUILDING FACILITIES AND A SPORTS COMPLEX. 23 PEOPLE WERE INTERVIEWED AND 15 WERE IN OPPOSITION.
